title: Robert Lambert (Master of St John's College, Cambridge)
text:
Robert Lambert, <a href="Doctor%20of%20Divinity">D.D.</a> (b <a href="Beverley">Beverley</a> 21 April 1677 - d <a href="Cambridge">Cambridge</a> 25 January 1735) was a priest and academic in the second half of the 18th and the first decades of the 19th centuries.
Lambert educated at <a href="St%20John%27s%20College%2C%20Cambridge">St John's College, Cambridge</a>. He graduated <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts">B.A.</a> in 1697, and <a href="Master%20of%20Arts%20%28Oxbridge%20and%20Dublin%29">M.A.</a> in 1700; and was a <a href="Fellow">Fellow</a> of St John's from then until his appointment as <a href="List%20of%20Masters%20of%20St%20John%27s%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Master</a> in 1727. <a href="Ordained">Ordained</a> in 1706, he was <a href="List%20of%20Vice-Chancellors%20of%20the%20University%20of%20Cambridge">Vice-Chancellor of the University of Cambridge</a> from 1727 until 1728, and again from 1729 until 1730.
